title: Literature Review: Existing Open-Source Pendulum Simulation Codebases
summary: Review of existing GitHub repositories implementing pendulum simulations in Python.

implementations_reviewed.name: thecodebeatz/pendulum-simulation
implementations_reviewed.description: Single pendulum ODE solver using SciPy's RK45 (dopri5) integrator with Matplotlib visualization
implementations_reviewed.architecture: Single script, uses scipy.integrate.solve_ivp for ODE solving, Matplotlib for plotting angle vs time

implementations_reviewed.name: SiliconWit/modelling-and-simulation-in-python
implementations_reviewed.description: Educational toolkit with both Euler and RK4 pendulum implementations
implementations_reviewed.architecture: Separate files for each method (1pendulum.py for Euler, 1pendulum-rk4.py for RK4). Uses raw NumPy arrays and Matplotlib.
strengths: Side-by-side comparison of Euler vs RK4

implementations_reviewed.name: Demiz1/SimplePendulum
implementations_reviewed.description: Simple pendulum simulation with angle, angular rate, and visual state plots
implementations_reviewed.architecture: NumPy-based implementation with Matplotlib animation. Plots theta(t), omega(t), and pendulum visualization.
strengths: Shows both angle and angular rate

implementations_reviewed.name: jakevdp triple pendulum blog
implementations_reviewed.description: Triple pendulum using SymPy's Kane's method and scipy.integrate.odeint
implementations_reviewed.architecture: Symbolic derivation with SymPy, numerical integration with SciPy, Matplotlib animation

design_lessons: Keep the core physics separate from visualization
Support multiple integration methods with a common interface
Track and plot energy conservation as a key diagnostic
Include phase portrait (theta vs omega) as standard output
Use fixed random seeds and save all parameters for reproducibility
